title: Investment Analysts' Weekly Ratings Changes for S & T Bancorp (STBA)
text:
Tweet 
A number of firms have modified their ratings and price targets on shares of S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ: STBA) recently: 7/23/2015 – S & T Bancorp had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by analysts at Keefe, Bruyette & Woods. 7/22/2015 – S & T Bancorp had its price target raised by analysts at Keefe, Bruyette & Woods from $31.00 to $33.00. They now have an “outperform” rating on the stock. 7/22/2015 – S & T Bancorp was upgraded by analysts at Zacks from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating. They now have a $37.00 price target on the stock. According to Zacks, “S & T BANCORP, INC. is a bank holding company which is engaged in general banking business. The Bank is a full service bank with its main office in Indiana, Pennsylvania, providing service to its customers through a branch of 34 offices located in Armstrong, Allegheny, Indiana, Jefferson, Clearfield and Westmoreland counties. The Bank’s services include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, making secured and unsecured commercial and consumer loans, providing letters of credit, and offering discount brokerage services, personal financial planning and credit card services. “ 7/22/2015 – S & T Bancorp had its price target raised by analysts at RBC Capital from $29.00 to $32.00. They now have a “sector perform” rating on the stock. 7/22/2015 – S & T Bancorp was downgraded by analysts at Piper Jaffray from an “overweight” rating to a “neutral” rating. They now have a $32.00 price target on the stock, up previously from $30.00. They noted that the move was a valuation call. They noted that the move was a valuation call. 
Shares of S & T Bancorp Inc ( NASDAQ:STBA ) traded up 0.13% on Tuesday, hitting $31.17. The stock had a trading volume of 15,005 shares. The stock has a 50 day moving average price of $30.51 and a 200-day moving average price of $28.84. The company has a market cap of $1.09 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 16.27. S & T Bancorp Inc has a 12-month low of $23.07 and a 12-month high of $32.88. 
S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ:STBA) last posted its earnings results on Tuesday, July 21st. The financial services provider reported $0.52 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the Thomson Reuters consensus estimate of $0.48 by $0.04. The firm had revenue of $62.20 million for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $59 million. During the same period in the previous year, the company posted $0.49 EPS. On average, equities analysts expect that S & T Bancorp Inc will post $2.04 earnings per share for the current year. 
The company also recently announced a dividend, which will be issued on Thursday, August 20th. Investors of record on Thursday, August 6th will be paid a dividend of $0.18 per share. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Tuesday, August 4th. 
In other S & T Bancorp news, Director James Thomas Gibson sold 75,000 shares of S & T Bancorp stock in a transaction that occurred on Thursday, July 23rd. The stock was sold at an average price of $32.54, for a total value of $2,440,500.00. The sale was disclosed in a filing with the SEC, which can be accessed through the SEC website . 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. ( NASDAQ:STBA ) is a bank holding company. The Company operates through its wholly owned subsidiaries, including S&T Bank, 9th Street Holdings, Inc. and STBA Capital Trust I. S&T operates in three segments: Community Banking, which offers services, which include accepting time and demand deposits, originating commercial and consumer loans, and providing letters of credit and credit card services; Wealth Management, which offers discount brokerage services, services as executor and trustee under wills and deeds, guardian and custodian of employee benefits and other trust and brokerage services, as well as a registered investment advisor that manages private investment accounts for individuals and institutions, and Insurance, includes an insurance agency offering commercial property and casualty insurance, group life and health coverage, employee benefit solutions and personal insurance lines. S&T owns a one-half interest in Commonwealth Trust Credit Life Insurance Company.
